member.name: T:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.EmbankmentCurve
member.summary: Embankment Curve that determines how the path blends into the environment.

member.name: T:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.Noise
member.summary: Noise types.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.size
member.summary: Width of the path without its embankment.

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.embankmentSize
member.summary: Width of the whole path including the embankment. Cannot be less than the .

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.shaping
member.summary: Terrain shaping on/off.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.elevation
member.summary: Relative elevation of the path. Negative values can be used to carve into the terrain.

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.slopeLimit
member.summary: [0-90] Used by the Auto Ramp feature. Slope limit of the path in degrees. 0f degrees results in a path that's in level, while 90f degrees inherently means no limit.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.embankmentCurve
member.summary: Embankment Curve that determines how the path blends into the environment.

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.evenRamp
P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.textureStrength
member.summary: [0-1 Normalized] Strength of the texture painting.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.texture
member.summary: TerrainLayer to be used for the path surface. Texturing off if null. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.embankmentTexture
member.summary: TerrainLayer to be used for the embankment. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.smartTexturePaint
member.summary: Disable if Embankment painting is desired over areas with Path surface texture.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.clearGrass
member.summary: Clear/thin Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) when drawing paths according to the settings: , , .

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.grassClearingDistance
member.summary: [Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be cleared up to this distance.

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.grassThinningDistance
member.summary: [0.01-1 Normalized] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) thinning distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be thinned with applied from the up to this distance.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.grassClearingNoise
member.summary: The type of applied to Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.clearTree
member.summary: Clear trees when drawing paths according to the settings: .

member.name: P:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.treeClearingDistance
member.summary: [0.01-1 Normalized] Tree clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Trees will be cleared up to this distance.

member.name: F:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.smoothPath
member.summary: Paint smooth paths when enabled.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.#ctor
member.summary: Initialise a painter.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.#ctor(System.Action{UnityEngine.Terrain})
member.summary: Initialise a painter with a record undo action. This action will be called to record undo on terrains.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.Init(System.Action{UnityEngine.Terrain})
member.summary: Init the painter with record undo action

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.SetDefaults
member.summary: Reset the Default options/settings.
Change all the settings and Paint a Path with Y positions relative to the terrain surface according to the and settings.
member.param: Worlds Space points of the path to be painted. Note: Y values are ignored. (similar to how mouse movement could be used by recording a point every time the mouse moves a certain distance)
Width of the path without its embankment.
Width of the whole path including the embankment. Cannot be less than the .
Embankment Curve that determines how the path blends into the environment.
Terrain shaping on/off.
[0-90] Used by the Auto Ramp feature. Slope limit of the path in degrees. 0f degrees results in a path that's in level, while 90f degrees inherently means no limit.
Relative elevation of the path. Negative values can be used to carve into the terrain.
[Value 0-1] Strength of the texture painting.
TerrainLayer to be used for the path surface. Texturing off if null. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
TerrainLayer to be used for the embankment. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
Disable if Embankment painting is desired over areas with Path surface texture.
Clear/thin Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) according to the settings: , , .
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be cleared up to this distance.
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be thinned with applied from the up to this distance.
The type of applied to Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning.
Clear trees according to the settings: .
[Value 0.01-1] Tree Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Trees will be cleared up to this distance.
Paint smooth paths when enabled.

member.summary: Change all the settings and Paint a Path with Y positions relative to the terrain surface according to the and settings.
member.param: Worlds Space points of the path to be painted. Note: Y values are ignored. (similar to how mouse movement could be used by recording a point every time the mouse moves a certain distance)
Width of the path without its embankment.
Width of the whole path including the embankment. Cannot be less than the .
Embankment Curve that determines how the path blends into the environment.
Terrain shaping on/off.
[0-90] Used by the Auto Ramp feature. Slope limit of the path in degrees. 0f degrees results in a path that's in level, while 90f degrees inherently means no limit.
Relative elevation of the path. Negative values can be used to carve into the terrain.
[Value 0-1] Strength of the texture painting.
TerrainLayer to be used for the path surface. Texturing off if null. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
TerrainLayer to be used for the embankment. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
Disable if Embankment painting is desired over areas with Path surface texture.
Clear/thin Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) according to the settings: , , .
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be cleared up to this distance.
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be thinned with applied from the up to this distance.
The type of applied to Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning.
Clear trees according to the settings: .
[Value 0.01-1] Tree Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Trees will be cleared up to this distance.
Paint smooth paths when enabled.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.Paint(System.Collections.Generic.List{UnityEngine.Vector3},Haven.API.PathPainter2.PaintOption[])
member.summary: Paint a Path using the current settings while optionally changing any settings as desired. Use static methods to pass in . Path Y positions will be relative to the terrain surface according to the and settings.
member.param: Worlds Space points of the path to be painted. Note: Y values are ignored. (similar to how mouse movement could be used by recording a point every time the mouse moves a certain distance)
An optional list of that specify the painting properties. Any values passed in here will change the presets. Use static methods.

member.summary: Paint a Path using the current settings while optionally changing any settings as desired. Use static methods to pass in . Path Y positions will be relative to the terrain surface according to the and settings.
member.param: Worlds Space points of the path to be painted. Note: Y values are ignored. (similar to how mouse movement could be used by recording a point every time the mouse moves a certain distance)
An optional list of that specify the painting properties. Any values passed in here will change the presets. Use static methods.

member.summary: Change all the relevant settings and paint a Path with explicit Y positions (i.e. the path surface will follow the in 3D).
member.param: Worlds Space points for the path to follow.
Width of the path without its embankment.
Width of the whole path including the embankment. Cannot be less than the .
Embankment Curve that determines how the path blends into the environment.
Terrain shaping on/off.
[0-90] Used by the Auto Ramp feature. Slope limit of the path in degrees. 0f degrees results in a path that's in level, while 90f degrees inherently means no limit.
Path elevation relative to the provided.
[Value 0-1] Strength of the texture painting.
TerrainLayer to be used for the path surface. Texturing off if null. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
TerrainLayer to be used for the embankment. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];
Disable if Embankment painting is desired over areas with Path surface texture.
Clear/thin Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) according to the settings: , , .
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be cleared up to this distance.
[Value 0.01-1] Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Grass will be thinned with applied from the up to this distance.
The type of applied to Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) Thinning.
Clear trees according to the settings: .
[Value 0.01-1] Tree Clearing distance ratio (ratio of one side-embankment width). Trees will be cleared up to this distance.
Paint smooth paths when enabled.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.StartBulkPaint(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Use bulk painting to avoid prep and Unity's terrain sync overheads. Usage: ; BulkPaint(); ... BulkPaint3D(); ;
member.param: World Space position used to select a group of terrains to painted on (tile at this position and surrounding tiles that are compatible with it). Any point can be usedn if it's above or below the group of terrains.
member.returns: Returns false if unable to lock on the target terrain tiles or if they are missing terrain elements.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.EndBulkPaint
member.summary: Use bulk painting to avoid prep and Unity's terrain sync overheads. Usage: ; BulkPaint3D(); ... BulkPaint(); ;
Change all the settings and start a New Line with Y positions relative to the terrain surface according to the and settings. Usage: Start a new line with /, add to it with and complete it with .
member.param: Worlds Space point of where the line starts. Note: Y values are ignored. (similar to how mouse movement could be used by recording a point every time the mouse moves a certain distance)

Disable if Embankment painting is desired over areas with Path surface texture.
Clear/thin Terrain Details (grass, flowers, etc.) according to the settings: , , .

member.summary: Option passed to the Path Painter API to set the Width of the whole path including the embankment. Cannot be less than the .

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.Elevation(System.Single)
member.summary: Option passed to the Path Painter API to set the Relative elevation of the path. Negative values can be used to carve into the terrain.

member.summary: Option passed to the Path Painter API to set Terrain shaping on/off.

member.name: M:Haven.API.PathPainter2.Painter.SlopeLimit(System.Single)
member.summary: [0-90] Option passed to the Path Painter API to set the slope limit. It's used by the Auto Ramp feature. Slope limit of the path in degrees. 0f degrees results in a path that's in level, while 90f degrees inherently means no limit.

member.summary: Option passed to the Path Painter API to set the TerrainLayer to be used for the embankment. Tip: You can get layers of terrain tiles by their index: layer = tile.terrainData.terrainLayers[index];

member.name: T:Haven.API.PathPainter2.PaintOption
member.summary: Class internally used to pass Paint options to Path Painter API functions. You don't use these directly, but construct them with the control functions in the PathPainterAPI class.
